ax-config.html.title: Global Configuration
ax-config.html.contents: $custom (Map) scss $custom: () !default; Configuration to be injected by consumers. Used By $merged $default (Map) scss $default: ( common: ( sizes: ( // xxs: -3, xs: -2, sm: -1, md: 0, lg: 1, xl: 2, // xxl: 3, ), ), layout: ( length: ( min: 2, max: 12, line: 4, ), container-function: meta.get-function("container"), ), typography: ( font-weights: ( // thin: 100, // extralight: 200, // light: 300, regular: 400, // medium: 500, // semibold: 600, bold: 700, // extrabold: 800, // black: 900,,,,,, ), line: ( min: 1.1, root: 1.5, ), measure-function: meta.get-function("measure"), scale: ( min: -2, max: 5, base: 1rem, // Major third, equal-tempered: âˆ›2 â‰… 1.26 // https://www.modularscale.com/?1&em&2@3 factor: math.pow(2, math.div(1, 3)), ), ), ui: ( color: ( // ), stroke: ( min: 1, max: 8, line: 24, ), ), ); Default configuration. Used By $merged $merged (Map) scss $merged: map.deep-merge($default, $custom); Map of all configuration values merged together. Requires $default (Map) $custom (Map) Used By Container Size Scale Length Scale Font Weights Line Heights Measure Scale Modular Font Size Scale Stroke Width Scale

ax-generic.html.title: Generic Rules
ax-generic.html.contents: normalize.css Stylament uses normalize.css for normalizing browser styling. Related Repo [external] nâ€™ize.css Stylament uses nâ€™ize.css to extend basic styling with slots for CSS custom properties. Related Repo [external] :target scss :target { // Give URL fragment target enough air. scroll-margin-block-start: var(--length-l3); } The current target element. :not(html, body, div, section, article, nav, main, header, footer, hgroup, ul, ol, menu, dl, dd, dt, li, table, figure, caption, label) scss :not(html, body, div, section, article, nav, main, header, footer, hgroup, ul, ol, menu, dl, dd, dt, li, table, figure, caption, label) { max-inline-size: var(--measure); } Establish a generic measure.

ax-properties.html.title: Custom Properties
ax-properties.html.contents: Basic Custom Properties This is a set of global custom CSS properties constituting the DNA of the design system. It was originally inspired by the well thought-through taxonomy of Pollen. Layout $sizes (Map) scss $sizes: (); Container sizes. Defined in Container Size Scale. Related Why SASS variables? [external] Used By Responsive Spacing Container Size Scale scss :root { $names: map.get(cfg.$merged, common, sizes); $func: map.get(cfg.$merged, layout, container-function); @each $name, $value in $names { $sizes: map.set($sizes, $name, meta.call($func, $value)) !global; --container-#{$name}: #{map.get($sizes, $name)}; } } Defines $sizes. Related Pollen inheritance [external] Requires $merged (Map) Length Scale scss :root { $min: map.get(cfg.$merged, layout, length, min); $max: map.get(cfg.$merged, layout, length, max); $line: map.get(cfg.$merged, layout, length, line); @include scale.length($min, $max, line.$rlh, $line); } Requires $merged (Map) $rlh (Number<rem>) Typography Font Families scss :root { --font-sans: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif; --font-serif: "Source Serif Pro", serif; --font-mono: "Source Code Pro", monospace; } Related Pollen inheritance [external] Font Weights scss :root { $weights: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, font-weights); @each $name, $value in $weights { @if $value { --weight-#{$name}: #{$value}; } } } Related Pollen inheritance [external] Requires $merged (Map) Letter Spacing scss :root { --letter-xs: -0.05em; --letter-sm: -0.025em; --letter-none: 0em; --letter-lg: 0.025em; --letter-xl: 0.05em; } Related Pollen inheritance [external] To-do List Configure and calculate this. $rlh (Number<rem>) scss $rlh: null; Root line-height. Defined in Line Heights. Related â€œrlhâ€: experimental CSS unit. [external] Line Heights Used By Length Scale Stroke Width Scale @function grid-line() Line Heights scss :root { $scale-base: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, base); $scale-factor: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, factor); $scale-min: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, min); $scale-max: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, max); $line-min: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, line, min); $line-root: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, line, root); $rlh: $line-root * $scale-base !global; --line-root: #{$line-root}; --line-root-abs: #{$rlh}; @for $i from $scale-min through $scale-max { $font-size: scale.modular($scale-base, $scale-factor, $i); --line-#{$i}: #{rhythm.grid-line($font-size, $rlh, $line-min)}; } } Line heights supporting the vertical rhythm at every step of the scale. Defines $rlh. Related Pollen inheritance [external] Vertical rhythm calculation tool [external] Requires $merged (Map) Measure Scale scss :root { $sizes: map.get(cfg.$merged, common, sizes); $func: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, measure-function); @each $name, $value in $sizes { --measure-#{$name}: #{meta.call($func, $value)}; } --measure-full: 100%; --measure-inf: unset; --measure: var(--measure-md); } Related Pollen inheritance [external] Wikipedia [external] Web Typography [external] Requires $merged (Map) Modular Font Size Scale scss :root { $base: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, base); $factor: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, factor); $min: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, min); $max: map.get(cfg.$merged, typography, scale, max); --scale-factor: #{$factor}; @for $i from $min through $max { --scale-#{$i}: #{scale.modular($base, $factor, $i)}; } --scale-smaller: #{math.div(100%, $factor)}; --scale-larger: #{100% * $factor}; } Related Pollen inheritance [external] Requires $merged (Map) UI Color Palette scss :root { --color-white: #f9fafb; --color-grey-100: #f2f4f5; --color-grey-200: #e8eaed; --color-grey-300: #d4d7dd; --color-grey-400: #a5aab4; --color-grey-500: #767c89; --color-grey-600: #555d6e; --color-grey-700: #3f4754; --color-grey-800: #2c343f; --color-grey-900: #10181c; --color-black: #070f12; --color-grey: var(--color-grey-500); --color-red-300: #fc8181; --color-red-500: #e53e3e; --color-red-700: #c53030; --color-red: var(--color-red-500); --color-green-300: #9ae6b4; --color-green-500: #48bb78; --color-green-700: #2f855a; --color-green: var(--color-green-500); --color-blue-300: #63b3ed; --color-blue-500: #4299e1; --color-blue-700: #3182ce; --color-blue: var(--color-blue-500); --color-pink-300: #fbb6ce; --color-pink-500: #ed64a6; --color-pink-700: #d53f8c; --color-pink: var(--color-pink-500); --color-purple-300: #b794f4; --color-purple-500: #805ad5; --color-purple-700: #6b46c1; --color-purple: var(--color-purple-500); --color-teal-300: #81e6d9; --color-teal-500: #38b2ac; --color-teal-700: #2c7a7b; --color-teal: var(--color-teal-500); --color-yellow-300: #faf089; --color-yellow-500: #ecc94b; --color-yellow-700: #d69e2e; --color-yellow: var(--color-yellow-500); --color-orange-300: #fbd38d; --color-orange-500: #ed8936; --color-orange-700: #dd6b20; --color-orange: var(--color-orange-500); --color-brown-300: #a1887f; --color-brown-500: #795548; --color-brown-700: #5d4037; --color-brown: var(--color-brown-500); } Related Pollen inheritance [external] To-do List Configure and calculate this. Easing Curves scss :root { --ease-in-sine: cubic-bezier(0.47, 0, 0.745, 0.715); --ease-out-sine: cubic-bezier(0.39, 0.575, 0.565, 1); --ease-in-out-sine: cubic-bezier(0.445, 0.05, 0.55, 0.95); --ease-in-quad: cubic-bezier(0.55, 0.085, 0.68, 0.53); --ease-out-quad: cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.46, 0.45, 0.94); --ease-in-out-quad: cubic-bezier(0.455, 0.03, 0.515, 0.955); --ease-in-cubic: cubic-bezier(0.55, 0.055, 0.675, 0.19); --ease-out-cubic: cubic-bezier(0.215, 0.61, 0.355, 1); --ease-in-out-cubic: cubic-bezier(0.645, 0.045, 0.355, 1); --ease-in-quart: cubic-bezier(0.895, 0.03, 0.685, 0.22); --ease-out-quart: cubic-bezier(0.165, 0.84, 0.44, 1); --ease-in-out-quart: cubic-bezier(0.77, 0, 0.175, 1); --ease-in-quint: cubic-bezier(0.755, 0.05, 0.855, 0.06); --ease-out-quint: cubic-bezier(0.23, 1, 0.32, 1); --ease-in-out-quint: cubic-bezier(0.86, 0, 0.07, 1); --ease-in-expo: cubic-bezier(0.95, 0.05, 0.795, 0.035); --ease-out-expo: cubic-bezier(0.19, 1, 0.22, 1); --ease-in-out-expo: cubic-bezier(1, 0, 0, 1); --ease-in-circ: cubic-bezier(0.6, 0.04, 0.98, 0.335); --ease-out-circ: cubic-bezier(0.075, 0.82, 0.165, 1); --ease-in-out-circ: cubic-bezier(0.785, 0.135, 0.15, 0.86); --ease-in-back: cubic-bezier(0.6, -0.28, 0.735, 0.045); --ease-out-back: cubic-bezier(0.175, 0.885, 0.32, 1.275); --ease-in-out-back: cubic-bezier(0.68, -0.55, 0.265, 1.55); --ease-default: ease-in-out; } Curves for transition easing. Related Pollen inheritance [external] Radius Scale scss :root { --radius-100: 100%; --radius-xs: 0.2rem; --radius-sm: 0.4rem; --radius-md: 0.6rem; --radius-lg: 0.8rem; --radius-xl: 1rem; --radius-full: 999rem; } Related Pollen inheritance [external] To-do List Configure and calculate this. Shadow Scale scss :root { --shadow-xxs: 0 0.0625rem 0.125rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); --shadow-xs: 0 0.0625rem 0.1875rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.0625rem 0.125rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06); --shadow-sm: 0 0.25rem 0.375rem -0.125rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.125rem 0.25rem -0.125rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06); --shadow-md: 0 0.75rem 1rem -0.25rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.25rem 0.375rem -0.125rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); --shadow-lg: 0 1.25rem 1.5rem -0.25rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.5rem 0.5rem -0.25rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.04); --shadow-xl: 0 1.5rem 3rem -0.75rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25); --shadow-xxl: 0 2rem 4rem -0.75rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2); } Box shadows for creating realistic elevation in 3d space. Related Pollen inheritance [external] To-do List Configure and calculate this. Consider using values that can also be used as text-shadow. Stroke Width Scale scss :root { $min: map.get(cfg.$merged, ui, stroke, min); $max: map.get(cfg.$merged, ui, stroke, max); $line: map.get(cfg.$merged, ui, stroke, line); @for $i from $min through $max { --stroke-width-#{$i}: #{line.$rlh * math.div($i, $line)}; } } A scale of stroke widths with $line units per root line. Requires $merged (Map) $rlh (Number<rem>) Logical Properties scss :root { --font-body: var(--font-serif); --font-heading: var(--font-sans); --font-display: var(--font-body); --weight-body: var(--weight-regular); --weight-emphasis: var(--weight-bold); --weight-heading: var(--weight-bold); --color-body: var(--color-black); --color-body-negative: var(--color-white); --color-neutral: var(--color-grey); --color-accent: var(--color-grey-700); --color-accent-negative: var(--color-grey-100); --color-mark: var(--color-grey-900); --color-mark-negative: var(--color-grey-300); --color-primary: var(--color-purple); --color-primary-light: var(--color-purple-300); --color-primary-dark: var(--color-purple-700); --color-heading: var(--color-accent); --color-links: var(--color-primary-dark); --color-links-negative: var(--color-primary-light); --color-hr: var(--color-primary); --spacing-block: var(--line-root-abs); --spacing-heading: var(--spacing-block); --spacing-sectioning: calc(2 * var(--spacing-block)); --spacing-inline: 4ch; --inline-padding-default: 0.5ch; --stroke-width-default: var(--stroke-width-2); --stroke-style-default: solid; --stroke-color-default: var(--color-neutral); } Responsive Spacing scss :root { @media (max-width: map.get(container.$sizes, "sm")) { --spacing-sectioning: var(--spacing-block); } } Save space on smaller screens. Requires $sizes (Map)

ax-tools.html.title: Preprocessing Tools
ax-tools.html.contents: @function grid-line() Base-line grid compatible line-height at a given font size. Parameters $em: Font size to fit. In rem. $rlh: Root line-height. In rem. $min: Minimum line-height ratio. Requires $rlh (Number<rem>) @function modular() Modular scale at a given level. Parameters $base: Base font size of the scale. $factor: Factor between adjacent steps of the modular scale. $level: Level on the scale. @mixin length() Numeric Length Scale This generates a scale of --length-<i> properties. The <i> indicates the number of sub-units the length is made up of. Logical Length Scale Additionally, there are aliases refer to use the main: --length-l<j>: exactly j lines --length-l<j>aug: a bit more than j lines --length-l<j>to<j+1>: right between j and j+1 lines --length-l<j+1>dim: a bit less than j+1 lines Parameters $start: Start of the scale. $end: End of the scale. $basis: Scale basis (unit), e. g. the root line height. $sub: Sub-division of the scale basis, i. e. how many sub-units per main unit.

el-document.html.title: General Document Structure
el-document.html.contents: General Document Structure The following rules target elements that are (or should be) unique to each document. In some cases compound selectors are required in order to only select the specific element. Nevertheless, we can address them without any added class specificity. html scss html { font-size: var(--scale-root, 100%); } Document root. Also selectable as :root (which has a higher specificity). Related Spec [external] MDN [external] body scss body { color: var(--color-body); background-color: var(--color-body-negative); // Push down the footer. min-block-size: 100vh; } Content root. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] main scss main { padding-block: var(--spacing-sectioning); } The documentâ€™s main content. There can be only one (visible). Related Spec [external] MDN [external] :where(body, body > div) > header scss :where(body, body > div) > header { @extend %clr-accented--inverted; padding-block: var(--spacing-sectioning); } The documentâ€™s main header. (There could be more than one. But that would not make much sense.) :where(body, body > div) > footer scss :where(body, body > div) > footer { // Clever sticky footer (https://css-tricks.com/a-clever-sticky-footer-technique/) position: sticky; inset-block-start: 100vh; // Spacing and color. @extend %clr-accented--inverted; padding-block: var(--spacing-sectioning); } The documentâ€™s main footer. (There could be more than one. But that would not make much sense.)

el-edits.html.title: Edits
el-edits.html.contents: Edits The ins and del elements represent edits to the document. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] del scss del { background: var(--color-red-300); } Deletion. ins scss ins { background: var(--color-green-300); } Insertion.

el-embedding.html.title: Embedding
el-embedding.html.contents: Embedding Embedding Containers No default styles needed. embed {} iframe {} object {} portal {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external] Multimedia Content No default styles needed. picture {} source {} img {} video {} audio {} track {} map {} area {} Related Spec (images) [external] Spec (embedded content) [external] Spec (media) [external] Spec (image maps) [external] MDN [external] Embedded Fragments of Other Markup Languages No default styles needed. svg {} math {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external]

el-forms.html.title: Form-associated Content
el-forms.html.contents: Form-associated Content These are elements which can be used together to create forms which the user can fill out and submit to the web site or application. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] General form scss form { } The form itself. button scss button { } Button. Submitting the form and other actionns. Labeling & Grouping label scss label { } Label. fieldset scss fieldset { } Fieldset. legend scss legend { } Legend. Inputs input scss input { } Input. textarea scss textarea { } Textarea. select scss select { } Select. Value Lists datalist scss datalist { } Datalist. option scss option { } Option. optgroup scss optgroup { } Optgroup. Outputs meter scss meter { } Meter. output scss output { } Output. progress scss progress { } Progress.

el-grouping.html.title: Grouping Content
el-grouping.html.contents: Block-level Text Content Definition list Self-contained figure Generic block div { /* Donâ€™t style the generic block! */ } List Paragraph Preformatted text Extended quotation Thematic break

el-interactive.html.title: Interactive Elements
el-interactive.html.contents: Interactive Elements These elements help to create interactive user interface objects. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] details scss details { } Details. The details element represents a disclosure widget from which the user can obtain additional information or controls. summary scss summary { } Summary. The summary element represents a summary, caption, or legend for the rest of the contents of the summary elementâ€™s parent details element, if any. dialog scss dialog { } Dialog. The dialog element represents a part of an application that a user interacts with to perform a task, for example a dialog box, inspector, or window.

el-scripting.html.title: Scripting
el-scripting.html.contents: Scripting Scripts allow authors to add interactivity to their documents. Elements dedicated to scripting normally do not require styling. script {} noscript {} canvas {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external]

el-sectioning.html.title: Sectioning
el-sectioning.html.contents: Sectioning Heading Content Sectioning Scope Specific Elements Sections

el-tables.html.title: Tabular Content
el-tables.html.contents: Tabular Content The elements here are used to create and handle tabular data (data with more than one dimension). Related Spec [external] MDN [external] table scss table { --border-width: var(--table-border-width, 0rem); border-collapse: collapse; padding: 0; border-spacing: 0; margin-block: calc(-0.5 * var(--border-width)); } The table itself. caption scss caption { margin-inline: auto; } Table caption. thead scss thead { } Table header. tbody scss tbody { } Table body. tfoot scss tfoot { } Table footer. tr scss tr { } Table row. td, th scss td, th { border: var(--border-width) var(--table-border-color) var(--table-border-style); padding: calc(0.5 * (var(--line-root-abs) - var(--border-width))); } Table cells.

el-text.html.title: Text-level Semantics
el-text.html.contents: Inline Text Semantics Altered Baseline Citation Inline Code Data Directionality Emphasis Enhanced Semantics Generic range span { /* Donâ€™t style the generic range! */ } Input/Output Line Breaks Inline Quotation Ruby Terminology

index.html.title: Stylament Documentation
index.html.contents: Stylament A fundament for your document styling. This is gonna be solid. And flexible. At the same time. ðŸ˜² Awesome! What? âš ï¸ Spoiler âš ï¸: Yes, this is yet another HTML & CSS framework. Stylament is a framework or a blueprint for building well-structured and prettily-styled web pages. Why? After decades of using HTML & CSS frameworks like Foundation and Bootstrap, giving fresh candidates like Bulma a try, even fighting popular misconceptions like â€œutility firstâ€ ðŸ™„, I finally wanted to build my own thing. ðŸ’ª I am well-aware of the existence of a bazillion of CSS frameworks out there. And I know about the notion that CSS frameworks in general suck. So, who needs another one? â€“ Well, I do. Why? Because itâ€™s probably true: CSS frameworks suck. At least, they tend to be less helpful the more confident you are writing CSS from scratch. In other words: Having your website depend on a CSS framework can quickly become a pain in the ass. Bloated stylesheets, littered mark-up, opinionated solutions you donâ€™t agree with. How does that make sense? Building a CSS framework because CSS frameworks are bad? Itâ€™s not that they are intrinsically bad. Itâ€™s just that expecting such a framework to fit every use-case is futile. If you want an API (as in, a set of building blocks and means to customize them) that fits (almost) any kind of web document just rely on vanilla HTML and vanilla CSS. Itâ€™s as easy as that. But itâ€™s also easy to mess up. Of course, you need to establish reasonable structures for your HTML and CSS. Potentially reusable structures. Thatâ€™s where your own personal HTML & CSS framework comes into play. Now it makes sense. ðŸ˜Œ That being said, I canâ€™t tell if this project will ever be useful for anyone but me. Maybe people can learn from it, just as I have learned from others. How? ðŸš§ N. B.: The how is subject to change. A lot. Configure @use "stylament/css/axioms" with ( $config-custom: ( typography: ( font-weights: ( light: 300, regular: null, medium: null, semibold: null, bold: null, extrabold: 800, ), scale: ( min: -3, max: 9, factor: 1.5, ), line: ( root: 1.2, ), ), ) ); @use "stylament/css/elements"; @use "stylament/css/objects"; @use "stylament/css/utilities";

ob-navigation.html.title: Navigation
ob-navigation.html.contents: Main Navigation Bar Rather opinonated styling for the first nav.e-menu. body > nav.e-menu:first-of-type scss body > nav.e-menu:first-of-type { $size: var(--length-l2); --item-block-size: #{$size}; --item-line-height: var(--length-l1dim); --item-padding: var(--length-l1dim); --toggle-size: #{$size}; --toggle-padding: var(--length-l0to1); --toggle-background: var(--color-accent-negative); --toggle-shadow: var(--shadow-sm); --toggle-folded-shadow: var(--shadow-lg); & > menu { box-shadow: var(--shadow-sm); & > li { @extend %clr-accented--inverted; transition: all 0.3s var(--ease-default); &:hover { @extend .clr-accented; } & > a { color: inherit; background-color: transparent; font-weight: var(--weight-emphasis); text-decoration: none; } } } } The first nav.e-menu is implicitly considered the main menu. Navigation Menu Common patterns for navigation menus. Separated into several aspects. $nav-wide scss $nav-wide: map.get(container.$sizes, "sm"); Breakpoint for switching to wide layout. $size scss $size: 2em; Size factor of the menu. nav.e-menu scss nav.e-menu { --item-block-size: #{$size}; display: flex; flex-direction: row; align-items: flex-start; & > input[id^="-toggle-state"], & > label[for^="-toggle-state"] { display: none; } & > menu { flex-grow: 1; } } General navigation menu. This is the basic selector with the basic rules applied. nav.e-menu.\+levelable scss nav.e-menu.\+levelable { & > menu { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; & > li { display: block; text-align: center; // Horizontal nav as long as items have enough space. // https://heydonworks.com/article/the-flexbox-holy-albatross/ flex-basis: calc(($nav-wide - 100%) * 999); flex-grow: 1; } } } Levelable Nav. Places items on a horizontal level if enough space is available. nav.e-menu.\+foldable scss nav.e-menu.\+foldable { --toggle-size: #{$size}; /// Places toggle to the inline end (rhs in Latin). &.\+end { flex-direction: row-reverse; } & > label[for^="-toggle-state"] { cursor: context-menu; display: block; & > :first-child, &:empty::after { display: block; position: relative; // Place over backdrop. inline-size: var(--toggle-size); block-size: var(--toggle-size); padding: var(--toggle-padding); border: var(--toggle-border); margin: 0; font-size: calc(var(--toggle-size) - 2 * var(--toggle-padding)); line-height: 1; text-align: center; font-weight: var(--weight-emphasis); transition: all 0.3s var(--ease-default); background: var(--toggle-background); border-radius: var(--toggle-radius); box-shadow: var(--toggle-shadow); content: var(--toggle-content, "â‹®"); } } & > menu { margin-bottom: -100%; // Do not occupy flow space when foldable. max-inline-size: 100%; overflow: hidden; transition: max-inline-size 0.3s var(--ease-default); } // Special behavior on narrow screen: Act as overlay with backdrop. @media (max-width: $nav-wide) { & > input[id^="-toggle-state"] { // Unfolded state on narrow screen. &:checked { // Use `label` as backdrop. Clicking on it toggles the state. & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"]::before { content: ""; position: absolute; inset: 0; block-size: 100vh; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5); } } // Folded state on narrow screen. (This is the default, as in not checked.) &:not(:checked) { & ~ menu { @include menu-folded; } & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"] > :first-child, & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"]:empty::after { @include toggle-folded; } } } & > menu { position: relative; // Place over backdrop. } } // Folded state on wide screen. (Only when explicitly toggled.) @media (min-width: $nav-wide) { & > input[id^="-toggle-state"]:checked { & ~ menu { @include menu-folded; } & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"] > :first-child, & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"]:empty::after { @include toggle-folded; } } } } Foldable Nav. Allows to toggle the display of the menu. &.\+end scss &.\+end { flex-direction: row-reverse; } Places toggle to the inline end (rhs in Latin). nav.e-menu.\+sticky scss nav.e-menu.\+sticky { position: sticky; inset-block-start: 0; z-index: 1; } Sticky Nav. Makes navbar stick to the top of the viewport.

ob-special.html.title: More Specific Styling
ob-special.html.contents: Homepage Header body.s-homepage > header scss body.s-homepage > header { @extend .clr-accented; --radius-box: var(--radius-md); --stroke-width-box: var(--stroke-width-8); & > * { @extend .l-center-box; @extend %l-center--intrinsic; } // Any image alone in an hgroup row is considered a logo. hgroup > * > img:only-child { // Size it so that it nicely fits the viewport. max-inline-size: 66vmin; max-block-size: 66vmin; // Donâ€™t measure-limit width of logo container. :has(&) { max-inline-size: none; } } } Special homepage header styles.

undefined.html.title: <un-grouped>
undefined.html.contents: thead + tbody scss thead + tbody { th:first-child { text-align: start; } } Do not center th in vertical tables.

ut-layout.html.title: Layout Utilities
ut-layout.html.contents: .u-measure-#{$name} scss .u-measure-#{$name} { --measure: var(--measure-#{$name}) !important; } Specify individual measure. .u-wrap-reset scss .u-wrap-reset { grid-column: 1 / -1 !important; max-inline-size: unset !important; flex: 100% !important; } Reset wrapping.
